title: Perma Ban
body: I've been perma ban for a pretty good reason, but ive spent over $1000 AUD and i think that its kind of unfair just to have all this money thrown away. Is there a way that i can recover my account or get some of my money back?

replies.body:
"you already got the enjoyment for the money u spent"

That sure is a funny way to look at what is advertised as a permanent unlock.

So we should let rich people out of prison because they are rich?

Everyone is held to the same standard of behaviour regardless of how much money they have or are likely to spend on the game, because how much disposable income you have has absolutely no impact on your behaviour or how that behaviour affects others. 

With the exceptions of behaviours like cheating, you will always receive a warning before a permanent suspension. At that point, it's the player's choice to heed it or not.

Cursing is not a crime anywhere that isn't a totalitarian shit hole (Riot HQ?), so yes, they should be let out of jail, but not for the half baked reason you suggest. 

"So we should let rich people out of prison because they are rich?"
Maybe you shouldn't use a strawman in lieu of real understanding. I know mods are usually the personality type to add their 2 cents to everything despite having an empty wallet, but do try to resist that urge for our sake.

It was an analogy, I'm sure you got the point. It's also worth considering that some things like threats *are* in fact a crime.

Riot has the right to moderate the game the way they see fit since it's their game and all. Being a business they are going to moderate the game in a way that makes the majority happy since it makes that majority more likely to spend money and/or spread the game and introduce new people. They are also going to moderate to their M rating.

As players, we agree to follow a code of conduct in order to play the game. Fail to do so and you lose the right to play the game, except Riot is lenient enough to put the consequence on the account rather than the player unless there is actual criminal activity involved.

Also, you don't get punished just for cursing.

"Riot is lenient enough to put the consequence on the account rather than the player unless there is actual criminal activity involved"
Well that is provably false, ip bans are a thing, and have been given to toxic players. Not that that is relevant to this thread.

"you don't get punished just for cursing."
You get punished for being reported for cursing. All riot does is use a filter to match words and phrases to reports and you get banned. They are unable, or unwilling, to catch inting and griefing so they rely on a 2 bit algorithm to flag naughty words. The 2% wr nunu is all you need to look at to confirm that. It is completely worthless to a player base who all have access to tools they can use to censor for themselves.

You want to talk about riots business model? The way they make opening loot boxes, missions, and every other damn thing in the client as tedious as humanly possible to encourage sunken cost fallacies the same way gambling does? [This genius design?](https://i.imgur.com/tcgVqtO.png) 

Banning accounts is just a great way to ensure whales like OP get to pay twice for their favorite champs and skins, and don't think riot hasn't included _that _ in their business model. They've been itching to ban him for a long time.

No they aren't? The only time RIot attempted to ban a player instead of an account was Tyler1. It was a mess because they didn't have policies in place to handle such a thing. They set the policies and decided that account bans and not player bans were still the way to go, even for players like him who were consistently toxic on new accounts because of the speed at which such accounts were banned.

Reported or not you don't get punished for cursing. You might get punished for cursing *at* someone, but it's not the cursing that is relevant, it's the targeted insult/abuse/etc. The system isn't a word filter, the system physically could not function effectively that way - [this post does a good job explaining why](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/Ifb0rpEJ-riot-should-just-make-a-list-of-banned-words-and-how-not-to-be-condescending).

The only terms that come close to a word filter are the no tolerance terms such as 'kys', and even then there is context to consider (e.g "who says shit like 'kys' to strangers on the internet?" should obviously not be banned).

Slow, does not mean ineffective, it means inefficient. They can and do punish for int-ing, griefing, etc but it's slower than the chat system because behaviour is harder to verify than words. In saying that, a not insubstantial percentage of int/griefing reports are bad games or bad decisions, not *intentional* feeding or griefing.

My thoughts on loot boxes are rather irrelevant, unhappy players don't spend money. It's literally in Riot's financial interest to keep their majority happy in whatever form that takes.

As for people with banned accounts spending more money, even if we assume that those players do spend more money despite losing all the money they've spent before (which most just don't do), the percentage of perma-banned accounts is minuscule. As in 0.06%

Somehow, I don't think 0.06% of *accounts* (as in not even players) are the big money makers for Riot.
Riot is a morally bankrupt company pandering to the crying children under it's employ that actually believe other peoples chat can affect their player experience in the same way a 2% wr nunu can.

Have you considered that other people have a different perspective from you?

Personally, I would rather play with a complete and blatant troll throwing my ranked game, than someone throwing threats and 'kys' around.

I don't speak for everyone of course, but neither do you. The troll may affect you more than any chat, but that is not true of everyone.

Trolls don't lose games. That is the goal of ranked, to win. Riot bans without any threats. It takes nothing more than calling someone a terrible player who is ruining your player experience to trigger it. How ironic the reason riot ban people for using chat is the reason those people are using chat in the first place. An irony completely lost on their delicate collective, and the concept of muting never enters the discussion because Riot HQ = authoritarian shithole.

"it's not the cursing that is relevant" WROOONG

Turns out the league terms are a goldmine, who would have guessed this company would try and enforce over reaching and vague terms of service? O:
5.1.
The following are examples of behavior that warrant disciplinary measures:
v.         Transmitting or communicating any content which is deemed offensive, including language that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, defamatory, **vulgar**, obscene, sexually explicit, or racially, ethically, or **otherwise objectionable**;

Riot games and Tencent. The supreme custodians of free speech.

Authoritarian. Shithole. Taiwan number 1. Tiananmen square 1989 年天安门广场.
that sure is unfortunate, what a terrible company.
ive never gotten a 14-day ban or any warning
Then what was the stated reason for the ban?
"a player-triggered review found your in-game comms extremely inflammatory and offensive, your account's been pemanently suspended."

Presumably, that came with a chat log. You cannot receive a permanent suspension for chat without receiving at least a 14-day suspension first. About the only exception might be if there were serious threats involved.

If you believe you have not received a 14-day ban in the past, then follow HeartVine's advice and follow through the player support process: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

You could become a successful streamer. Riot will bend over backwards for publicity. Other than that, no, your bad words that are easily mutable justify theft. Your the only one responsible for other players experience.

The only way to successfully appeal a ban is if it was made in error, either in a situation where no punishment should have been issued, or a less severe punishment should have been issued. Depending on the reason for the ban (should come up in the reform card and in the email regarding the ban), you should have received *at least* a 14-day ban prior (specific exceptions include 3rd party software, charge-backs and security bans). You *wont* be able to get a refund for any money spent on the account.

You can feel free to appeal by submitting a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) (use the "Discuss a personal suspension or restriction" option), but whether they change anything depends on the specific circumstances of your case.

The short answer is no.

The slightly longer explanation is that a permanent suspension should never be a surprise. Unless you were banned for cheating you've received at least one warning, including a 14-day ban that would have explicitly stated that any further offences would result in permanent suspension.
